title: Setup Flow Chart - Replacement Keys and Keyless ECM - Models with an Electronic Steering Lock Fitted

body.body: Setup Flow Chart - Replacement Keys and Keyless ECM - Models with an Electronic Steering Lock Fitted
Before starting the set up procedure, the electronic steering lock must be disconnected from the main harness.
Batt and seat removal PM1; PR1; PRB; PRC; PS1; PSB; PSC; PWC; PX1; PXB; PXC; PY1; PYB; PYC

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: PWC; PSB; PRB; PYB; PXB; PYC; PXC; PSC; PRC; PY1; PX1; PS1; PR1; PM1

body.body: Disconnect the Electronic Steering Lock Connector
Disconnect steering lock PM1; PR1; PRB; PRC; PS1; PSB; PSC; PWC; PX1; PXB; PXC; PY1; PYB; PYC
Detach the front and lower ends of the rubber covers from the left hand electrical connector housing.
Release the locking device and detach the electronic steering lock connector from the left hand electrical connector housing.
Disconnect the electronic steering lock connector from the main harness.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: PWC; PYB; PXB; PSB; PRB; PYC; PXC; PSC; PRC; PY1; PX1; PS1; PR1; PM1

body.body: Replacement Keys and Keyless ECM - Setup Flow Chart
It can take up to 30 minutes to complete the system pairings, downloads and calibrations necessary for correct keyless ECM setup.
Before starting the setup procedure, make sure the battery voltage is at least 12.8 Volts.
An approved battery charger suitable for use with maintenance free batteries, may be used to maintain battery charge during the setup process.
Connect the Electronic Steering Lock Connector
Connect steering lock PM1; PR1; PRB; PRC; PS1; PSB; PSC; PWC; PX1; PXB; PXC; PY1; PYB; PYC
Connect the electronic steering lock connector to the main harness.
Attach the electronic steering lock connector to the left hand electrical connector housing.
Secure the front and lower ends of the rubber covers to the left hand electrical connector housing.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: PWC; PYB; PXB; PSB; PRB; PYC; PXC; PSC; PRC; PY1; PX1; PS1; PR1; PM1

body.body: Batt and seat install link PM1; PR1; PRB; PRC; PS1; PSB; PSC; PWC; PX1; PXB; PXC; PY1; PYB; PYC

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: PWC; PYB; PXB; PSB; PRB; PYC; PXC; PSC; PRC; PY1; PX1; PS1; PR1; PM1

search: Setup Flow Chart - Replacement Keys and Keyless ECM - Models with an Electronic Steering Lock Fitted
Before starting the set up procedure, the electronic steering lock must be disconnected from the main harness.
Perform the following operations:
Rider’s Seat - Removal
Battery - Removal
Disconnect the Electronic Steering Lock Connector
Detach the front and lower ends of the rubber covers from the left hand electrical connector housing.
Cover (radiator assembly removed for clarity)
Front retaining lug
Release the locking device and detach the electronic steering lock connector from the left hand electrical connector housing.
Disconnect the electronic steering lock connector from the main harness.
Electronic steering lock connector
Locking device
Replacement Keys and Keyless ECM - Setup Flow Chart
It can take up to 30 minutes to complete the system pairings, downloads and calibrations necessary for correct keyless ECM setup.
Before starting the setup procedure, make sure the battery voltage is at least 12.8 Volts.
An approved battery charger suitable for use with maintenance free batteries, may be used to maintain battery charge during the setup process.
Connect the Electronic Steering Lock Connector
Connect the electronic steering lock connector to the main harness.
Attach the electronic steering lock connector to the left hand electrical connector housing.
Secure the front and lower ends of the rubber covers to the left hand electrical connector housing.
Cover (radiator assembly removed for clarity)
Front retaining lug
Perform the following operations:
Battery - Installation
Rider’s Seat - Installation
